intro: Romulea × dielsii, commonly known as the hybrid marsh orchid, is a perennial geophyte native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant features a bulbous corm and linear, grass-like leaves that help it survive in its native habitat. Its flowers are often pink or purple and are adapted for pollination by insects. Romulea × dielsii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
